p:
In 1992, the prevalence of new cases of non-B, non-C hepatocellular carcinoma was only 6·5%, but in 2010 it increased to 24·1% ( appendix p 7).
224 The number of patients who died with non-B, non-C hepatocellular carcinoma increased 5·4 times in 24 years, from 1741 in 1992 to 9389 in 2015. The relative increase of non-B, non-C hepatocellular carcinoma is due to the decrease in the number of cases caused by HCV.
